description: Cluster designed for tagging OSINT artifacts with relevant strategic framework information. Specifically for Block-H, these tags are related to Healthcare Cybersecurity management of information security incidents.
name: HITRUST CSF - Incident Management

values.description: Management establishes a quick, effective and orderly response to information security incidents.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.a Incident Management Program

values.description: Employees and contractors using the organizationâ€™s information systems and services are required to note and report any observed or suspected information security weaknesses in systems or services.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.c Reporting Information Security Weaknesses

values.description: Information security events are assessed and classified as information security incidents if appropriate.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.d Assessments of and Decision on Information Security Events

values.description: Responses to information security incidents are conducted accordance with the documented procedures.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.e Response to Information Security Incidents

values.description: Knowledge gained from analyzing and resolving information security incidents are used to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.f Learning from Information Security Incidents

values.description: Evidence is identified, collected, acquired and preserved.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.g Collection of Evidence

values.description: Information security events are reported through appropriate  channels as quickly as possible.
values.value: OSRS HITRUST CSF Incident Management: 12.b Reporting Information Security Events
